studyDesigns.name: Study Design
studyDesigns.rationale: Protocol-defined study design for investigating efficacy and safety

arms.name: ALXN1840 Treatment
arms.description: All participants are initiated on 15 mg/day of ALXN1840 for approximately 28 days, followed by a dose titration to 30 mg/day starting on Day 29.

studyCohorts.name: Treatment-experienced
studyCohorts.characteristic: Patients who have received WD therapy for > 28 days

studyCohorts.name: Treatment-naïve
studyCohorts.characteristic: Patients who have received WD therapy for ≤ 28 days

population.name: Study Population
population.description: Target population for the study as defined by eligibility criteria

objectives.name: Primary Objective
objectives.text: Assess net copper balance with daily repeat-dose ALXN1840 treatment (15 mg and 30 mg) in participants with Wilson disease (WD)

objectives.name: Secondary Objective 1
objectives.text: Assess change in copper balance in response to ALXN1840 15 mg/day and 30 mg/day during ALXN1840 accumulation and at steady state periods versus the pretreatment baseline in participants with WD

objectives.name: Secondary Objective 2
objectives.text: Investigate the effect of ALXN1840 (15 mg/day and 30 mg/day) on the disposition of copper in participants with WD

objectives.name: Secondary Objective 3
objectives.text: Investigate the effect of ALXN1840 on the disposition of molybdenum at steady state at 15 mg/day and 30 mg/day in participants with WD

objectives.name: Secondary Objective 4
objectives.text: Assess steady-state total molybdenum balance as a measure of ALXN1840 15 mg/day and 30 mg/day in participants with WD

objectives.name: Secondary Objective 5
objectives.text: Assess accumulation of molybdenum with ALXN1840 treatment at 15 mg/day and 30 mg/day in participants with WD

objectives.name: Secondary Objective 6
objectives.text: Determine the steady-state plasma pharmacokinetic (PK) of total molybdenum and plasma ultrafiltrate (PUF) molybdenum (as surrogate measures of ALXN1840, 15 mg and 30 mg) in participants with WD

objectives.name: Safety Objective
objectives.text: Evaluate the safety and tolerability of repeated-dose administration of ALXN1840 15 mg/day and 30 mg/day in participants with WD

objectives.name: Exploratory Objective 1
objectives.text: Determine dose response of ALXN1840 15 mg/day and 30 mg/day for copper balance in participants with WD

objectives.name: Exploratory Objective 2
objectives.text: Determine the effect of treatment duration on copper balance in participants with WD

objectives.name: Exploratory Objective 3
objectives.text: Assess the effects of ALXN1840 on ceruloplasmin, ceruloplasmin-bound copper LBC profiles in plasma in participants with WD

endpoints.name: Primary Endpoint
endpoints.text: Mean daily copper balance where copper balance is measured by the calculated difference between copper intake (in food and drink) and copper output (in feces and urine) during ALXN1840 accumulation and steady-state periods for each dose

endpoints.name: Secondary Endpoint 1
endpoints.text: Change in mean daily copper balance as measured by the calculated difference between copper intake (in food and drink) and copper output (in feces and urine) from pretreatment baseline (Days -4 through -1) and ALXN1840 accumulation and steady-state periods for each dose

endpoints.name: Secondary Endpoint 2
endpoints.text: Copper quantified in food, drink, feces, and urine, including plasma total and labile bound copper (LBC) during ALXN1840 accumulation and steady-state periods for each dose

endpoints.name: Secondary Endpoint 3
endpoints.text: Molybdenum quantified in food, drink, feces, and urine, plasma total molybdenum at ALXN1840 steady state

endpoints.name: Secondary Endpoint 4
endpoints.text: Mean daily molybdenum balance as demonstrated through measurement of molybdenum intake (in food, drink and ALXN1840), and molybdenum output (feces and urine) representing ALXN1840 steady state

endpoints.name: Secondary Endpoint 5
endpoints.text: Accumulation of molybdenum as determined by molybdenum balance

endpoints.name: Secondary Endpoint 6
endpoints.text: PK parameters for plasma total and PUF-molybdenum

endpoints.name: Safety Endpoint
endpoints.text:
Safety parameters: 
• Treatment emergent adverse events (TEAEs)/serious adverse events (SAEs) 
• Clinical laboratory assessments (serum chemistry, hematology, coagulation, and urinalysis) 
• Physical examinations 
• Heart rate, intervals (PR, QRS, QT and QTc), and clinically significant electrocardiogram (ECG) findings as determined by triplicate 12-lead ECG 
• Vital sign assessments (blood pressure and heart rate)

endpoints.name: Exploratory Endpoint 1
endpoints.text: Assess dose response of ALXN1840 on copper balance focusing on copper balance

endpoints.name: Exploratory Endpoint 2
endpoints.text: Determine the effect of time following initiation of ALXN1840 treatment on copper balance

endpoints.name: Exploratory Endpoint 3
endpoints.text: Ceruloplasmin, ceruloplasmin-bound copper, and LBC: Change in ceruloplasmin at Days 1, 8, 25, 29, 36, and Day 39 compared with predose

studyInterventions.name: ALXN1840
studyInterventions.description: ALXN1840 (bis-choline tetrathiomolybdate; formerly known as WTX101) is a novel copper binding agent in development for the treatment of Wilson disease (WD).

studyInterventions.name: Paracetamol/acetaminophen
studyInterventions.description: Permitted for use as an exception with the approval of the Investigator at doses of a maximum 1000 mg per day.

studyInterventions.name: Ibuprofen
studyInterventions.description: Permitted for use with caution and approval of the Investigator. The dose must not exceed 1200 mg in any 24-hour period.

activities.name: HIV, hepatitis B and C screen
activities.description: HIV, hepatitis B and C screen

activities.name: Blood sampling for PK: Plasma total Mo and PUF-Mo
activities.description: Blood sampling for PK: Plasma total Mo and PUF-Mo

activities.name: PD: Plasma total and PUF-Cu, LBC, ceruloplasmin, ceruloplasmin-bound Cu
activities.description: PD: Plasma total and PUF-Cu, LBC, ceruloplasmin, ceruloplasmin-bound Cu

activities.name: Urination and bowel movement monitoring, menstruation checks
activities.description: Urination and bowel movement monitoring, menstruation checks

notes.text: a. Within 42 days of ALXN1840 administration. Details of procedures that may be performed by sites designated as “screening sites” (only in the US) are detailed in Section 8.
b. Participants will be admitted to the clinical research unit (CRU) at least 10 hours prior to enrollment and initiation of copper- and molybdenum-controlled diet.
c. At the CRU’s discretion, participants may remain in the CRU or be readmitted on Day 22 with all procedures starting on Day 23.
d. Unscheduled study visits may occur at any time during the study and may include any study procedure as deemed necessary by the investigator.
e. Participants are required to return to the CRU Day 54+/-2; participants will be discontinued from ALXN1840 medication by their physician at the latest by the Day 54 follow-up.

f. Discharge from the unit may occur after completion of all procedures on Day 9 and on Day 40 and after the investigator has reviewed all safety assessment (including safety laboratory tests) and confirmed that the participant is appropriate for discharge.

g. A single outpatient visit or phone call and safety laboratory assessment should occur between Day 14 and Day 18. A phone call may take place on a different day than the blood draw within the Day 14 through Day 18 period.
h. If needed to confirm menopause.
i. Medical history will include age and sex. Race and ethnicity will be collected where permitted by local regulations.
j. Wilson disease history will include diagnosis date, method of diagnosis, history of cirrhosis, details of any previous liver biopsies performed, and treatment received.

k. A full physical examination will be performed at Screening, at check-in for the study, and at the End of the study/Early Termination Visit. A physical examination should also be performed on any participants with ongoing adverse events prior to discharge from the unit. Otherwise, a symptom-driven physical examination may be performed at other times, at the Principal Investigator’s discretion.
l. Height at screening only.

m. While in the CRU, study intervention will be administered after an overnight fast (ie, at least 10 hours) at the same time every morning; drug is to be administered with 240 mL of water and meals should be delayed a minimum of 2 hours after dosing. As an outpatient, participants are expected to take ALXN1840 at approximately the same time daily (+/- 1 hour). Participants should take the medication with a glass of water on an empty stomach; meals should be delayed a minimum of 2 hours after dosing.
n. During the outpatient period, participants will use SMS text messaging to confirm study intervention administration.
o. Blood sampling for PK/PD will occur before ALXN1840 administration and represents a predose trough. See Table 2 for PK/PD sampling on Days 1, 25, 29, and 39.
p. PK/PD collection will include timepoints described in the schedule of PK/PD assessment for Days 1, 25, 29, and 39 (Table 2).

q. Samples for serum chemistry will be obtained following a fast of at least 8 hours at the Screening Visit and at check-in. In case of rechecks, and postdose serum chemistry, participants may not have fasted for 6 or 8 hours before the serum chemistry sample is taken.
r. Laboratory assessment including chemistry, hematology, and coagulation parameters should be performed on Days -8, -1, 8, 23, and 28 only.

s. Menstruation check is for women only; women of childbearing potential should only be enrolled after a negative serum pregnancy test result at Screening. Additional urine pregnancy testing will be obtained for the protocol unless serum testing is required by site policies, local regulation, or Institutional Review Boards (IRBs)/Independent Ethics Committees (IECs) (Section 10.2). In addition to pregnancy tests detailed at the visits in the SoA, females of childbearing potential will be required to perform urine pregnancy tests at least every 4 weeks at their home or the study site throughout their time in the study.
t. A single 15 mL serum sample will be retained for evaluation in the event of an unexpected safety finding; retained samples may be destroyed after completion of the clinical study report.

u. Vital signs assessments and ECGs should be performed predose, unless otherwise specified. Vitals signs include body temperature, heart rate, respiratory rate, and systolic and diastolic blood pressure.

v. Copper- and molybdenum-controlled diet will be initiated after registration/inclusion. Participants will remain on a copper/molybdenum controlled diet throughout both the inpatient Period 1 (Day -8 to Day 9) and inpatient Period 2 (Day 23 to Day 40); during this time participants will be strongly encouraged to complete all meals. While not in the CRU, participants will be encouraged to adhere to their usual copper-controlled diet.
w. For each input/output balance period, 24-hour urine samples are to be collected for measurement of copper and molybdenum.
x. For fecal samples, each individual sample will be independently collected with record of date, time, and weight of the sample.

titles.text: A Phase 2, Open-label Study to Assess Copper and Molybdenum Balance in Participants with Wilson Disease Treated with ALXN1840
Copper and Molybdenum Balance in Participants with Wilson Disease Treated with ALXN1840

type.decode: US FDA Investigational New Drug Application Number

study.name: A Phase 2, Open-label Study to Assess Copper and Molybdenum Balance in Participants with Wilson Disease Treated with ALXN1840

administrations.name: ALXN1840 dose reduction
administrations.duration: Dose modification for specific adverse events until resolution of abnormality.

substances.name: bis-choline tetrathiomolybdate
substances.description: Active ingredient of ALXN1840. Also referred to as WTX101.

substances.name: tetrathiomolybdic acid
substances.description: Each 15 mg ALXN1840 tablet contains 7.8 mg of tetrathiomolybdic acid.

studyDefinitionDocument.name: A Phase 2, Open-label Study to Assess Copper and Molybdenum Balance in Participants with Wilson Disease Treated with ALXN1840

studyAmendments.summary: The main reason for preparation of this amendment was to clarify study procedures occurring across different sites in the US, so as to facilitate participant recruitment across different regions of the US, and to lessen inconvenience for participants without compromising the quality of the study.
The main reason for preparation of this amendment was to update the washout period for zinc.

The main reason for preparation of this amendment was to revise the exclusion criterion for a urine drug screen. Changes implemented via Administrative Letter 1 and Administrative Letter 2, as well as COVID vaccination guidance, have also been incorporated.

The main reason for preparation of this amendment was to update procedures outlined in the Schedule of Activities, remove contradictory text on the reporting of serious adverse events, and add details of an interim analysis.

procedures.name: Venipuncture
procedures.label: Blood Draw
procedures.description: Collection of blood samples for pharmacokinetic (PK), pharmacodynamic (PD), clinical safety laboratory assessments (serum chemistry, hematology, coagulation), pregnancy testing, and other screening tests (HIV, hepatitis).

code.decode: Collection of venous blood by venipuncture

procedures.name: Urine Collection
procedures.label: Urine Sample Collection
procedures.description: Collection of urine for various tests including drug screen, pregnancy tests, urinalysis, and 24-hour collection for copper and molybdenum content measurement.

code.decode: Urinalysis, by dip stick or tablet reagent

procedures.name: Fecal Collection
procedures.label: Stool Sample Collection
procedures.description: Collection of fecal samples for the measurement of copper and molybdenum content.

procedures.name: Physical Examination
procedures.label: Physical Exam
procedures.description: A complete physical examination including assessments of the cardiovascular, respiratory, gastrointestinal, and neurological systems.

procedures.name: Vital Signs Measurement
procedures.label: Vital Signs
procedures.description: Assessment of body temperature, heart rate, respiratory rate, and systolic and diastolic blood pressure.

procedures.name: 12-lead Electrocardiogram
procedures.label: ECG
procedures.description: Triplicate 12-lead ECG to assess heart rate, intervals (PR, QRS, QT and QTc), and other clinically significant findings.

code.decode: Electrocardiogram, routine ECG with at least 12 leads; with interpretation and report

procedures.name: Height, Weight, and BMI Measurement
procedures.label: Anthropometric Measurements
procedures.description: Measurement of participant's height, weight, and calculation of Body Mass Index (BMI).

procedures.name: Adverse Event Monitoring
procedures.label: AE Monitoring
procedures.description: Ongoing monitoring and collection of information on adverse events (AEs) and serious adverse events (SAEs).

procedures.name: Food and Fluid Sample Collection
procedures.label: Dietary Sample Collection
procedures.description: Collection of samples from all meal and fluid batches to measure copper and molybdenum content.

procedures.name: Bowel and Urine Output Monitoring
procedures.label: Intake/Output Monitoring
procedures.description: Monitoring and recording of urination and bowel movements.

procedures.name: Cannula Placement
procedures.label: IV Cannula Placement
procedures.description: Placement of an intravenous cannula to minimize needle sticks for repeated blood draws.

code.decode: Introduction of needle or intracatheter, vein

procedures.name: Neurological Assessment
procedures.label: Neurological Monitoring
procedures.description: Regular monitoring for neurologic adverse events and neurological dysfunction.

medicalDevices.name: Automated Blood Pressure Monitor
medicalDevices.label: Automated BP Device
medicalDevices.description: A completely automated device for assessing blood pressure and heart rate measurements.

medicalDevices.name: Intravenous Cannula
medicalDevices.label: IV Cannula
medicalDevices.description: A cannula placed in a vein to allow for repeated blood draws while minimizing needle sticks.

medicalDevices.name: Inductively Coupled Plasma Mass Spectrometer
medicalDevices.label: ICP-MS
medicalDevices.description: Laboratory equipment used to determine the copper and molybdenum concentration of food, fluid, urine, and fecal samples.

conditions.name: Moderate Transaminase Elevation
conditions.description: Criteria for temporary dose interruption due to liver enzyme elevation.
conditions.text: ALT or AST > 3 to <= 5 x ULN

conditions.name: Severe Transaminase Elevation
conditions.description: Criteria for permanent discontinuation due to severe liver enzyme elevation.

conditions.name: Hy's Law Criteria
conditions.description: Criteria for dose interruption due to potential severe liver injury.
conditions.text: Bilirubin > 2 x ULN accompanied by ALT > 3 x ULN

conditions.name: Hemoglobin Decrease
conditions.description: Criteria for dose reduction due to anemia.
conditions.text: Hemoglobin < 10 g/dL or > 20% decrease from baseline

conditions.name: Platelet Decrease
conditions.description: Criteria for dose reduction due to thrombocytopenia.

conditions.name: Neutrophil Decrease
conditions.description: Criteria for dose reduction due to neutropenia.
conditions.text: Neutrophils > 30% decrease from baseline and below reference range at baseline

conditions.name: Neurologic Worsening
conditions.description: Criteria for potential dose modification due to neurologic symptoms.
conditions.text: Evidence of neurologic worsening by AEs or by neurologic physical exam assessment

conditions.name: Psychiatric Worsening
conditions.description: Criteria for potential dose modification due to psychiatric symptoms.
conditions.text: Evidence of clinically significant acute psychiatric worsening which may include but not limited to suicidality, acute depression, or psychosis.

conditions.name: Safety Concerns Pre-Titration
conditions.description: General safety criteria that may prevent dose titration.
conditions.text: Safety concerns that, in the opinion of the Investigator(s) and/or Alexion, may place participants at undue risk.

conditions.name: General Discontinuation Criteria
conditions.description: List of events that trigger consideration for study intervention discontinuation.
conditions.text: Serious hypersensitivity reaction; Severe uncontrolled infection; Use of disallowed medication; Pregnancy or planned pregnancy.

transitionRules.name: Dose Titration to 30mg
transitionRules.text: On Day 29, participants will be titrated up to 30 mg/day, unless there are safety concerns.

transitionRules.name: Dose Interruption for Moderate LFT Elevation
transitionRules.text: If ALT or AST > 3 to <= 5 x ULN, temporarily interrupt dosing.

transitionRules.name: Discontinuation for Severe LFT Elevation
transitionRules.text: If ALT or AST > 5 x ULN, discontinue study intervention.

transitionRules.name: Dose Reduction for Hematologic Toxicity
transitionRules.text: If hemoglobin, platelet, or neutrophil criteria are met, reduce dose to previous dose level or to 15 mg QOD if on 15 mg QD.

transitionRules.name: Dose Interruption for Hy's Law
transitionRules.text: If Bilirubin > 2x ULN with ALT > 3x ULN, temporarily interrupt dosing.

transitionRules.name: Dose Modification for Neurologic/Psychiatric Worsening
transitionRules.text: If neurologic or psychiatric worsening occurs, Investigator and Alexion Medical Monitor will evaluate the need for dose modification (interruption, increase or decrease).

transitionRules.name: Discontinuation for General Safety Reasons
transitionRules.text: Participants must be considered for discontinuation from study intervention for serious hypersensitivity, severe infection, disallowed medication use, or pregnancy.

scheduleTimelineExits.name: Study Completion
scheduleTimelineExits.description: A participant is considered to have completed the study if he/she has completed all phases of the study including the last scheduled procedure shown in the Schedule of Activities.

scheduleTimelineExits.name: Participant Withdrawal of Consent
scheduleTimelineExits.description: A participant may withdraw from the study at any time at his/her own request.

scheduleTimelineExits.name: Investigator Discretionary Withdrawal
scheduleTimelineExits.description: A participant may be withdrawn at any time at the discretion of the Investigator for safety, behavioral, compliance, or administrative reasons.

scheduleTimelineExits.name: Lost to Follow-up
scheduleTimelineExits.description: A participant will be considered lost to follow-up if he or she repeatedly fails to return for scheduled visits and is unable to be contacted by the study site.

scheduleTimelineExits.name: Sponsor Termination of Study
scheduleTimelineExits.description: Alexion reserves the right to close the study site or terminate the study at any time for any reason.

scheduleTimelineExits.name: Site Closure
scheduleTimelineExits.description: Reasons for early closure of a study site include failure to comply with protocol, inadequate recruitment, or discontinuation of study intervention development.

analysisPopulations.name: Screened Set
analysisPopulations.description: All participants who signed an informed consent form (ICF).

analysisPopulations.name: Enrolled Set
analysisPopulations.description: All participants who were enrolled in the study.

analysisPopulations.name: Full Analysis Set
analysisPopulations.label: FA
analysisPopulations.description: All enrolled participants who received at least 1 dose of study drug. This set will be used for all efficacy analyses.
analysisPopulations.criteria: Enrolled and received at least 1 dose of study drug

analysisPopulations.name: Per Protocol Set
analysisPopulations.label: PP
analysisPopulations.description: All participants in the FA Set who have no major protocol deviations that would impact the primary efficacy endpoint. The specific criteria for exclusion from the PP Set will be determined and finalized prior to database lock. This set will be used for sensitivity analyses of the primary efficacy endpoint.
analysisPopulations.criteria: In FA Set with no major protocol deviations impacting the primary efficacy endpoint

analysisPopulations.name: Safety Set
analysisPopulations.label: SAF
analysisPopulations.description: All enrolled participants who received at least 1 dose of study drug. This set will be used for all safety analyses.
analysisPopulations.criteria: Enrolled and received at least 1 dose of study drug

analysisPopulations.name: Pharmacokinetic Analysis Set
analysisPopulations.label: PK
analysisPopulations.description: All participants in the Safety Set who have sufficient plasma concentration data to allow for the derivation of at least 1 PK parameter. This set will be used for all PK analyses.
analysisPopulations.criteria: In Safety Set with sufficient plasma concentration data for derivation of at least 1 PK parameter

analysisPopulations.name: Pharmacodynamic Analysis Set
analysisPopulations.label: PD
analysisPopulations.description: All participants in the Safety Set who have sufficient PD data to allow for the derivation of at least 1 PD parameter. This set will be used for all PD analyses.
analysisPopulations.criteria: In Safety Set with sufficient PD data for derivation of at least 1 PD parameter

characteristics.name: Age
characteristics.description: Age calculated from the date of birth and the date of informed consent. Summarized as a continuous variable and by age group (<18, 18 to <65, and ≥65 years).

characteristics.name: Sex
characteristics.description: Sex of the participant, summarized by counts and percentages.

characteristics.name: Race
characteristics.description: Race of the participant, summarized by counts and percentages.

characteristics.name: Ethnicity
characteristics.description: Ethnicity of the participant, summarized by counts and percentages.

characteristics.name: Body Mass Index (BMI)
characteristics.description: Baseline BMI will be calculated using the height and weight measurements from the Screening visit.

characteristics.name: Duration of Wilson Disease (WD)
characteristics.description: Duration of Wilson Disease at baseline.

characteristics.name: Baseline non-ceruloplasmin-bound copper (NCC)
characteristics.description: Baseline laboratory value for non-ceruloplasmin-bound copper (NCC).

characteristics.name: Medical History
characteristics.description: Medical history coded using MedDRA and summarized by system organ class (SOC) and preferred term (PT).

characteristics.name: Surgical History
characteristics.description: Surgical history coded using MedDRA and summarized by system organ class (SOC) and preferred term (PT).

characteristics.name: Prior medications for Wilson Disease
characteristics.description: Summary of prior medications used to treat Wilson Disease (WD).

commentAnnotations.text: Addition of text to the footnote to state that procedures specific to screening sites (only in the US) detailed in Section 8

commentAnnotations.sourceSection: Table 3: Potential Risks and Mitigation Strategy

commentAnnotations.text: Outpatient Period (Day 9 to Day 23) may be extended up to an additional 14 days... Limit: Not >14 days
Participants may be checked in on Day 22 rather than Day 23 at the Investigator discretion. Limit: Check-in to clinical research unit allowed 1 day prior
Dose range limit 15 mg every other day to 30 mg/day

Note: total molybdenum and PUF molybdenum concentration-time profiles on Day 28 after the last 15 mg ALXN1840 dose will be extrapolated to Day 29 (0-24 hr) and subtracted from the observed Day 29 concentration-time profiles after the first 30 mg

studyDefinitionDocumentVersions.description: Clarify study procedures in the US to facilitate participant recruitment and lessen inconvenience for participants.

studyAmendmentImpacts.description: Added a footnote to the Schedule of Activities to reference procedures for US-specific screening sites detailed in Section 8.

studyAmendmentImpacts.affectedSection: Section 4.2 Scientific Rationale for Study Design
studyAmendmentImpacts.description: Modified the number of days related to zinc discontinuation to align with other sections of the protocol.
Introduced the option for US sites to perform only screening procedures to facilitate participant recruitment.

studyAmendmentReasons.reasonText: To clarify study procedures occurring across different sites in the US, so as to facilitate participant recruitment across different regions of the US, and to lessen inconvenience for participants without compromising the quality of the study.
To align the number of days with the mention of zinc discontinuation elsewhere in the protocol.

studyChanges.afterText: Addition of text to the footnote to state that procedures specific to screening sites (only in the US) detailed in Section 8
studyChanges.summary: A footnote was added to the Schedule of Activities table to reference Section 8 for procedures at US-only screening sites.

studyChanges.beforeText: ...the inhibitory effect of zinc on intestinal copper absorption is expected to be minimal 30 days after discontinuation of zinc.
studyChanges.afterText: ...the inhibitory effect of zinc on intestinal copper absorption is expected to be minimal 21 days after discontinuation of zinc.
studyChanges.summary: The number of days for the expected minimal effect of zinc after discontinuation was changed from 30 to 21 for consistency.

studyChanges.afterText: Addition of text applicable only to the US that details the possibility for sites in the US to only perform screening procedures and not any of the remaining study procedures.
studyChanges.summary: Text was added to allow US sites to function solely as screening sites to improve recruitment and reduce participant burden.
